courseOverview: This course provides an introduction to HTML, the language used to structure content on the web. You will learn how to create and structure web pages, use common tags, and build a solid foundation for further web development learning.
willLearn: What HTML is and why it's important
How to structure web pages using HTML
Common HTML tags and their usage
Adding images and links to web pages
skills: Using semantic HTML for better web practices
prerequisites: Familiarity with using a web browser

sections.title: Introduction to HTML
sections.firstMessage:
Welcome to the 'Introduction to HTML' section! In this section, you'll learn what HTML is, its basic structure, and how to set up your first HTML file. The lessons included are:
1. What is HTML?
2. HTML Document Structure
3. Setting Up Your First HTML File

lessons.title: Setting Up Your First HTML File

sections.title: HTML Elements and Tags
sections.firstMessage:
In this section, we'll explore the different elements and tags you can use to build web pages. The lessons include:
1. Understanding Tags and Elements
2. Common HTML Tags
3. Nesting and Combining Tags

sections.title: Structuring Web Pages
sections.firstMessage:
This section covers how to properly structure your web pages using semantic HTML. The lessons are:
1. Using Headings and Paragraphs
2. Creating Lists
3. Adding Images and Links

sections.title: HTML Tables and Forms
sections.firstMessage:
In this section, we'll learn how to create tables and forms using HTML. The lessons include:
1. Creating Tables
2. Understanding Forms
3. Adding Input Elements

sections.title: Conclusion and Next Steps
sections.firstMessage:
Congratulations on completing the course! In this section, we'll summarize what you've learned and provide tips for your next steps. The lessons include:
1. Course Recap
2. Exploring Advanced HTML Topics
